data.event: There were at least ten Acadian settlers in the Bridgetown area before the French census of 1671, and the population doubled by 1707.

event.title: were expelled from Nova Scotia in 1755

data.event: Deed references suggest British settlement in Bridgetown from the early 1760s onward, after the Acadians were expelled from Nova Scotia in 1755.
These settlers appeared shortly after the allocation of Granville Township among its proprietors; Bridgetown is located in what was formerly Granville Township, settled from 1760 on.

event.title: was incorporated as a town in 1897

data.event: It was incorporated as a town in 1897.
